body_html:
Gunan, We were eventually able to get a working TF environment using the Anaconda framework. Thank you for all the help and suggestions. Dan
…
On Mon, Dec 19, 2016 at 5:31 PM, gunan ***@***.***> wrote: Another great suggestion I received from @aselle <https://github.com/aselle> is using cmake. That might be a much better solution, as bazel also does not have official support for SLES. I heard that a lot of our users on CentOS have successfully built TF using cmake. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Gunan,

We were eventually able to get a working TF environment using the Anaconda
framework.
Thank you for all the help and suggestions.

Dan

body:
Gunan,

We were eventually able to get a working TF environment using the Anaconda
framework.
Thank you for all the help and suggestions.

Dan

On Mon, Dec 19, 2016 at 5:31 PM, gunan <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Another great suggestion I received from @aselle
> <https://github.com/aselle> is using cmake.
> That might be a much better solution, as bazel also does not have official
> support for SLES.
>
> I heard that a lot of our users on CentOS have successfully built TF using
> cmake.
>
> —
